Package com.is2300.cmdlineparser

Class CmdLineParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.is2300.cmdlineparser.CmdLineParser
  • public class CmdLineParser
extends java.lang.Object
    CLArguments is a library for parsing command line arguments in an easy, intelligible and efficient manner. This parser breaks down the difference between switches and targets. Switches are typically single letter options that are prefixed with a single dash (-) or, word or multi-word options that are prefixed with a double dash (--). Targets are the parameters to the switches.

    For example, if your program requires a flag for debugging, you would provide a single boolean switch that takes no parameters, such as -d or --debug. Your program would then simply check if that switch was present, which would equate to debugging = true, or not, which would equate to debugging = false.

    Alternatively, if the debugging flag is present, you may want to set a debugging level for verbosity of output. In that use case, your program could check for the existence of the debugging flag (above) and, if it exists, check for the debugging level, which could be --debugging-level 2 for a medium verbosity output. In this instance, the switch is --debugging-level and the target is 2.

    This works for any type of switch and target. You can even have targets with no switches or multiple targets for each switch. If you need targets without a switch, those targets should be listed first on the command line, as this library interprets all targets following a switch as belonging to that switch, up to the next switch on the command line.

    Also, you can use this library to populate fields in your custom classes, provided you name your fields the same as the command line switch that gathers the data for those fields.

    This project is located on GitHub at https://github.com/SeanCarrick/CLArgParser .

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Version:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Sean Carrick <sean at carricktrucking dot com>

      • isSwitchPresent

        public boolean isSwitchPresent​(java.lang.String switchName)
        Checks to see if the given switch is present in the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        switchName - The command line switch to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the switch is present; falcse otherwise.

      • getSwitchValue

        public java.lang.String getSwitchValue​(java.lang.String switchName)
        Retrieve the value from the given switch.
        Parameters:
        switchName - The switch for which to retrieve the value.
        Returns:
        The value of the given switch.

      • getSwitchValue

        public java.lang.String getSwitchValue​(java.lang.String switchName,
                                       java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Retrieves the value for the given switch, or the default value if the given switch is not found.
        Parameters:
        switchName - The switch for which value is wanted.
        defaultValue - A default value in the event the switch is not present.
        Returns:
        The value, if the switch is present; the supplied default value if the switch was not found.

      • getSwitchLongValue

        public java.lang.Long getSwitchLongValue​(java.lang.String switchName)
        Retrieves the value for the given switch as a java.lang.Long.
        Parameters:
        switchName - The switch for which value is wanted.
        Returns:
        java.lang.Long value of the switch value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain a parsable long.

      • getSwitchValues

        public java.lang.String[] getSwitchValues​(java.lang.String switchName)
        Retrieves an array of java.lang.String values for the given switch.
        Parameters:
        switchName - The switch for which values are wanted.
        Returns:
        An array of java.lang.Strings containing all of the values associated with the given switch. If the switch is not found, an array of length zero (0) will be returned.

      • getSwitchPOJO

        public <T> T getSwitchPOJO​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Retrieves the switch and its values as a Plain Old Java Object (POJO).
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to which the switch and values should be placed into.
        Returns:
        java.lang.Object of the switch and its values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - in the event the POJO cannot be created.

      • getTargets

        public java.lang.String[] getTargets()
        Retrieves all targets as an array of java.lang.Strings. The targets that are returned are values that had no switch associated with them.
        Returns:
        All of the targets that did not have a switch associated with them.
